course_title: Special Topics in Women's, Gender and Sexuality Studies: Intersectional World-Building
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 20 / Seats Avail: 10Waitlist Total: 0 of 6
class_notes: In this "experiential" seminar, students will develop a broad understanding of how intersectional approaches to analyzing social structures and cultural phenomena inform the work of making political change. Hands-on experiences will include in-class and on-site visits with Atlanta-based social justice organizations, including one (overnight) weekend trip to El Refugio/Stewart Detention Center (Lumpkin, GA). Our semester will culminate in the creation of a campus-wide symposium. Please feel free to contact Dr. Olson (alix.olson@emory.edu) with any questions.
course_description: Individual topics and problems in Women's, Gender, and Sexuality Studies vary. May be repeated for credit when topic changes.
